sentence.Network_en: Crying is part of our natural expressiveness.
sentence.Network_cn: 哭泣是自然情感的一种表现。

sentence.Network_en: His painting rose to a fresh expressiveness and revealed a shrewder insight.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的画富有一种新的表达力,显示出更敏锐的洞察力.

sentence.Network_en: The audiences are impressed by the expressiveness of the actors.
sentence.Network_cn: 演员们的丰富表情给观众留下了深刻的印象.

entry.tran: 富于表情的;富于表现力的
entry.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as expressive, you mean that their behaviour clearly indicates their feelings or intentions.

example.ex: You can train people to be more expressive.
example.tran: 可以训练人们使其更具表现力。
她那张通常表情丰富的小脸

entry.def: If something is expressive of particular ideas or qualities, it has features which indicate or demonstrate them.

example.ex: Perhaps all his poems were really love poems, expressive of love for someone...
example.tran: 也许他所有的诗歌其实都是爱情诗，表现了对某个人的爱。

example.ex: Its history is expressive of the character and development of the people who possess it.
example.tran: 它的历史体现了其拥有者的性格特征和发展过程。
